Sentece: Receptor binding studies on the cloned human muscarinic receptors indicated that the new soft anticholinergic agents possessed moderate potency as pKi ranged from 6.7 to 7.6.
Title: Design, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic evaluation of soft anticholinergics based on tropyl alpha-phenylcyclopentylacetate.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Receptor binding studies on the cloned human muscarinic receptors indicated that the new soft anticholinergic agents possessed moderate potency as pKi ranged from 6.7 to 7.6.
Title: Design, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic evaluation of soft anticholinergics based on tropyl alpha-phenylcyclopentylacetate.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Mydriatic studies in rabbit eyes revealed that the duration of the action of the new soft anticholinergics (8.5-11.0 h) were shorter than that of atropine (about 24 h) under pharmacodynamic equivalent dose, and one of them, 18a, showed even shorter than that of tropicamide.
Title: Design, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic evaluation of soft anticholinergics based on tropyl alpha-phenylcyclopentylacetate.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Mydriatic studies in rabbit eyes revealed that the duration of the action of the new soft anticholinergics (8.5-11.0 h) were shorter than that of atropine (about 24 h) under pharmacodynamic equivalent dose, and one of them, 18a, showed even shorter than that of tropicamide.
Title: Design, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic evaluation of soft anticholinergics based on tropyl alpha-phenylcyclopentylacetate.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Receptor binding studies of the soft anticholinergics on cloned muscarinic receptors indicated pKi values in the range of 7.5 to 8.9.
Title: Design, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic evaluation of a new class of soft anticholinergics.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: The highest concentration of tropicamide was found in aqueous humor (Cmax: 29430 ng/g), while was in cornea for phenylephrine (Cmax: 3465 ng/g).
Title: An UPLC-MS/MS Method for Simultaneous Determination of Tropicamide and Phenylephrine in Rabbit Ocular Tissues and Plasma.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: The highest concentration of tropicamide was found in aqueous humor (Cmax: 29430 ng/g), while was in cornea for phenylephrine (Cmax: 3465 ng/g).
Title: An UPLC-MS/MS Method for Simultaneous Determination of Tropicamide and Phenylephrine in Rabbit Ocular Tissues and Plasma.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Tropicamide was rapidly absorbed systemically with the mean peak concentration in plasma being 2.8 +/- 1.7 ng/ml (mean +/- SD) at five minutes after instillation.
Title: Systemic absorption and anticholinergic activity of topically applied tropicamide.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Tropicamide disappeared rapidly from the systemic circulation: drug concentration in plasma was 0.46 +/- 0.51 ng/ml (mean +/- SD) at 60 minutes and below 240 pg/ml at 120 minutes after instillation.
Title: Systemic absorption and anticholinergic activity of topically applied tropicamide.
Name: Tropicamide

Sentece: Tropicamide bound to muscarinic receptors of rat brain with an apparent equilibrium binding constant (Ki-value in plasma) 220 +/- 25 nM (mean +/- SD, n = 3).
Title: Systemic absorption and anticholinergic activity of topically applied tropicamide.
Name: Tropicamide
